basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ I'm Yeoh Hui Qing, a to-be Year 3 Computer Science undegraduate at National University of Singapore (NUS)! I'm currently interning for the summer as a WCMS Developer, and is working on expanding my knowledge for front-end development, software engineering and UI/UX designs!

projects.title: Ufie - Orbital Project
projects.description: The first mobile application I had opportunity to create! I've learned many technologies together with my partner. Ufie is a meet-up scheduler mobile application that allows you to meet with your friends more conveniently!

projects.title: RIP - Game Dev Project
projects.description: One of the first elaborate game I have built with a team of 4 other friends on Unreal Engine 4 for a school project under CS3247. I was in charge of map design, assets creation and game logic. Rest In Peace (RIP) is a top-down third person action game that challenges the player to survive zombies attacks and achieve victory by collecting crystals scattered across the map. Click on the link above to download the game if you would like to challenge yourself at it ;)

projects.title: Shopee Compare
projects.description: Shopee Compare is my team's proposed idea to help improve the existing Shopee app to help users make better purchase decisions when shopping on the platform. This idea has led our team to the Semi-Finals of the Shopee UI/UX Challenge 2021. You can view our prototype in the link attached :)

projects.title: Reportise
projects.description: UI/UX Design project for a private company working on sharing news in bite-sized summaries to combat the problem of information overload in today's world. Reportise is a news-sharing and social platform where users can pay-as-you-read. I was responsible for revamping the site UI/UX to optimise the site's novel features for users. :)

projects.title: Incoming Crisis Game
projects.description: Incoming Crisis is a prototype for a mobile game I created during my internship at NTUC Income for a Design Thinking Project. The purpose of the game is to teach fresh graduates/young adults about financial planning and insurance in an interactive and engaging manner such that understanding how to plan their finances is made easy and accessible.

projects.title: Qredits - QR Marketplace
projects.description: Qredits is a QR marketplace for shoppers and brick-and-mortar merchants, where shoppers can purchase vouchers in the form of QR codes in the application, and merchants (cashiers) can scan the QRs to apply offers to their customers. Customers can earn royalty points to then receive offers for future QR voucher purchases. This application prototype was developed within a 2-day period for the Citibank Citi HackOverflow 2021 competition, together with my 3 other team mates - Bik Jeun, Wei Liang and Jun Hao. You can view our pitch deck here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1QLSNnHl1ASLyxQKpH4BKNq9OolQRoddnQHVpDAGpYFQ/edit?usp=sharing

experience.title: Deputy Director for Graphics and Content
